speaker: you
text: Morning everyone! Ready for standup?

speaker: coworker_1
text: Hey! Yeah, let me grab my coffee first.

speaker: you
text: Sure, take your time. Did you see the PR I put up yesterday?

speaker: coworker_1
text: The one for the stance vector update? Yeah, looks good. I'll review it after standup.

speaker: you
text: Alright, standup time. Yesterday I worked on the multi-round deliberation feature. Got the consensus detection working.

speaker: coworker_2
text: Nice! How does the consensus threshold work?

speaker: you
text: It checks if 70% of agents agree on urgency level. If they do, we can exit early without running all rounds.

speaker: coworker_1
text: I need to finish the API endpoint for the dashboard today. Should have it done by end of day.

speaker: coworker_2
text: I'm blocked on the database migration. Can someone help me with the foreign key issue?

speaker: you
text: I can help you with that after lunch. Let me finish the voice rendering first.

speaker: coworker_2
text: Perfect, thanks!

speaker: you
text: Hmm, I'm thinking about the architecture for the emotion tracking. Should we use a separate service or embed it in the main engine?

speaker: coworker_1
text: Separate service would be cleaner, but adds latency. What's the latency budget?

speaker: you
text: Good point. We need sub-100ms for the real-time feel. Maybe embedded is better for now, we can extract later.

speaker: coworker_1
text: Yeah, premature optimization and all that. Start simple.

speaker: you
text: Actually, I think the bigger question is whether to use WebSockets or Server-Sent Events for the real-time updates.

speaker: coworker_1
text: WebSockets are more flexible, but SSE is simpler if you only need server-to-client.

speaker: you
text: True. For the TUI we only need server-to-client. Let me think about it more.

speaker: you
text: Anyone else hungry? I was thinking of ordering from that new Thai place.

speaker: coworker_2
text: Ooh yes! I love Thai food. Get me the pad thai please.

speaker: you
text: Sure! And honestly, I really fancy some eclairs for dessert. There's that French bakery around the corner.

speaker: coworker_2
text: Oh nice! I'm more of a croissant person myself, but eclairs are good too.

speaker: you
text: I'll grab a few. Anyone else want anything sweet?

speaker: you
text: Okay, back to the bug. The issue is in the authentication middleware.

speaker: coworker_1
text: What's happening exactly?

speaker: you
text: The JWT token isn't being validated properly. It's accepting expired tokens.

speaker: coworker_1
text: That's a security issue. We should fix that before the release.

speaker: you
text: Agreed. I need to update the validation logic and add proper expiration checks.

speaker: coworker_1
text: Hey, also don't forget to rotate the API keys. The current ones have been in use for too long.

speaker: you
text: Oh right, I keep putting that off. I'll add it to my todo list. Actually, I should do it this week before I forget.

speaker: coworker_1
text: Yeah, it's been on the backlog for months. Better safe than sorry.

speaker: you
text: Finally got the token validation working. All tests pass now.

speaker: coworker_1
text: Great! Push it up and I'll review.

speaker: coworker_2
text: Hey, are you still free to help with that database issue?

speaker: you
text: Yes! Sorry, got caught up in the security fix. Let me look at it now.

speaker: coworker_2
text: No worries. The issue is with the cascade delete on the user_sessions table.

speaker: you
text: Ah I see. You need to set ON DELETE CASCADE in the foreign key constraint. Let me show you.

speaker: you
text: Alright, I think I'm going to head out soon. Need to figure out dinner.

speaker: coworker_1
text: Same here. Long day! Have a good evening.

speaker: you
text: You too! See you tomorrow.
